natural problem:
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ $d$ be real numbers such that
\[\frac{(a - b)(c - d)}{(b - c)(d - a)} = \frac{2}{5}.\]Find the sum of all possible values of
\[\frac{(a - c)(b - d)}{(a - b)(c - d)}.\]
natural solution: From the given equation, $5(a - b)(c - d) = 2(b - c)(d - a),$ which expands as \[5ac - 5ad - 5bc + 5bd = 2bd - 2ab - 2cd + 2ac.\]This simplifies to $2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd = 5ad + 5bc,$ so \[ad + bc = \frac{2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd}{5}.\]Then

\begin{align} \frac{(a - c)(b - d)}{(a - b)(c - d)} &= \frac{ab - ad - bc + cd}{ac - ad - bc + bd} \\ &= \frac{ab + cd - \frac{2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd}{5}}{ac + bd - \frac{2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd}{5}} \\ &= \frac{5ab + 5cd - 2ab - 3ac - 3bd - 2cd}{5ac + 5bd - 2ab - 3ac - 3bd - 2cd} \\
&= \frac{3ab - 3ac - 3bd + 3cd}{-2ab + 2ac + 2bd - 2cd} \\ &= \frac{3(ab - ac - bd + cd)}{-2(ab - ac - bd + cd)} \\ &= \boxed{-\frac{3}{2}}. \end{align}

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "(a - b) * (c - d) / ((b - c) * (d - a)) = 2 / 5"
shows  "(a - c) * (b - d) / ((a - b) * (c - d)) = -3 / 2"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ $d$ be real numbers such that
\[\frac{(a - b)(c - d)}{(b - c)(d - a)} = \frac{2}{5}.\]Find the sum of all possible values of
\[\frac{(a - c)(b - d)}{(a - b)(c - d)}.\] The final Answer is -\frac{3}{2}
 ### Proof
 From the given equation, $5(a - b)(c - d) = 2(b - c)(d - a),$ which expands as \[5ac - 5ad - 5bc + 5bd = 2bd - 2ab - 2cd + 2ac.\]This simplifies to $2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd = 5ad + 5bc,$ so \[ad + bc = \frac{2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd}{5}.\]Then
 \begin{align} \frac{(a - c)(b - d)}{(a - b)(c - d)} &= \frac{ab - ad - bc + cd}{ac - ad - bc + bd} \\ &= \frac{ab + cd - \frac{2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd}{5}}{ac + bd - \frac{2ab + 3ac + 3bd + 2cd}{5}} \\ &= \frac{5ab + 5cd - 2ab - 3ac - 3bd - 2cd}{5ac + 5bd - 2ab - 3ac - 3bd - 2cd} \\
 &= \frac{3ab - 3ac - 3bd + 3cd}{-2ab + 2ac + 2bd - 2cd} \\ &= \frac{3(ab - ac - bd + cd)}{-2(ab - ac - bd + cd)} \\ &= \boxed{-\frac{3}{2}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c d :: real
assumes h0 : "(a - b) * (c - d) / ((b - c) * (d - a)) = 2 / 5"
shows  "(a - c) * (b - d) / ((a - b) * (c - d)) = -3 / 2"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
